column4: I've got an Asus M2N32-Deluxe motherboard, it has built in wireless & wired connections. How can i completely disable the wireless (it seems to be giving me errors)
gives errors or causes actaul problems?, and bios is good plave to start if you intend totally disable something

kevin_123, i have been getting crashes and freezes, and the only errors ive gotten before hand relate to my wireless, os i want to disable it completely. might try the bios, but I have no idea where to find it
throw dmesg into pastebin and i check it after i get back to X
and one option is also type rmmod "yourwirelessdriver"
or remove its driver from /lib/modules/2.6.zzz/........ or blacklist it
yea i was thinking that but i dont know the driver :/
do you expect an out put from that?
maybe.. if you get lucky your wireless driver has wire in its name
well i didnt get a response
you have to wait few minutes, have reboot for new kernel
in tty , while new kernel compiles
